acf.heading: Get a Wellbutrin (bupropion) prescription online.
acf.first_paragraph: Select your symptoms within the Maple app so the doctor can evaluate your symptoms and condition. Enter as much information as possible so that the doctor can make a thorough assessment.

accordion.accordion_title: What is Wellbutrin (bupropion) and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Wellbutrin is primarily used to treat depression. It does so by helping to restore the balance of certain chemicals (neurotransmitters) in your brain. This medication can overall improve the mood and feelings of well-being.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for Wellbutrin (bupropion)?
accordion.accordion_intro: Wellbutrin is often used as a first-line antidepressant in the treatment of major depressive disorder and seasonal affective disorder. Wellbutrin is also frequently used to aid in smoking cessation, due to its ability to reduce nicotine withdrawal symptoms.
Wellbutrin is available as a tablet and should be taken as directed by a doctor. This medication can be taken with or without food, twice daily. Tablet forms come in doses varying from 75mg to 150mg.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of Wellbutrin (bupropion)?
accordion.accordion_intro:
As your body adjusts to this medication, Wellbutrin may cause:

  • Nausea, vomiting, dry mouth
  • Headache
  • Constipation
  • Increased sweating, joint aches, sore throat, blurred vision

Additionally, some users may experience chest pain, fainting, fast/pounding/irregular heartbeat, hearing problems, mental/mood changes or unusual weight loss or gain. If any of these severe side effects occur, it is important to speak to a doctor as soon as possible.

Wellbutrin should not be used if you’ve suddenly stopped taking sedatives (including benzodiazepines such as lorazepam), drugs used to treat seizures, or alcohol. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed and should not be used when breastfeeding. This medication should also not be used 14 days after taking MAO inhibitors, if there is an allergy to bupropion, or by those who have a seizure disorder, or an eating disorder (anorexia or bulimia).
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
